== Main Inclusion Report for userconfig ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/u/userconfig/]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** We want it on the Kubuntu CD to replace KUser, as it is integrated with the System Settings configuration tool and is easier to use.
 0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=userconfig|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: none
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=userconfig|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: ...
** Provides a KConfig Module which is run by root through the kcmshell4 wrapper by System Settings
** Network activity: connects to a web page
** Does not directly (not through a library) process binary (video, audio, etc) or structured (PDF, etc) data
** No known source code review
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** No debconf questions
** Not in Debian
** <nowiki>[[https://code.launchpad.net/~kubuntu-members/guidance/userconfig-kde4/|Upstream]]</nowiki> is calm
** No upstream bug tracker
** Hardware: Does not deal with hardware
** No test suite
 0. ''UI standards:''
** Strings translated with gettext
** End-user applications ships a desktop file, so that it shows up in System Settings
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliance 
** Packaging system is cdbs
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** Qt, KDE, Qt/KDE python bindings, all in main
 0. ''Maintenance:''
** Minimal maintenance needed
** Kubuntu team will maintain this application
 0. ''Background information:''
** The general purpose and context of the package is clear from the package's debian/control file. It is a KDE4 port of the userconfig utility that used to be shipped with the kde-guidance project before it was discontinued.
** Upstream calls it userconfig
